intro: Aphanopleura zangelanica, commonly known as the Zangelanica spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, particularly in the Mediterranean climate zones. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and striking yellow-orange flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Aphanopleura zangelanica is often found in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
